docs.abstract: Can a meal be more than just a delicious coming together of fine ingredients? Can it alter your feelings in predictive ways? The Michelin-starred chef Joël Robuchon and his neuropharmacologist have created dishes to cure what ails you. Plus: A trout recipe that will make you happier.

docs.lead_paragraph: Marijuana is casting an ever-thickening haze across NFL locker rooms, and it's not simply because more players are using it.

headline.main: NFL Seeks Right Answer for Marijuana Use
headline.print_headline: NFL Seeks Right Answer for Marijuana Use

docs.snippet: Marijuana is casting an ever-thickening haze across NFL locker rooms, and it's not simply because more players are using it.

docs.lead_paragraph: A large international study questions the conventional wisdom that most people should cut back on salt, suggesting that the amount most folks consume is OK for heart health — and too little may be as bad as too much. The findings came under immediate attack by other scientists.

headline.main: Study Questions Need for Most People to Cut Salt
headline.print_headline: Study Questions Need for Most People to Cut Salt

docs.snippet: A large international study questions the conventional wisdom that most people should cut back on salt, suggesting that the amount most folks consume is OK for heart health — and too little may be as bad as too much. The findings came under...

docs.lead_paragraph: FIGUR--Arthur. The Association of the Attending Staff of the Mount Sinai Hospital deeply mourns the passing of our long-standing and devoted friend, mentor and colleague. Dr. Figur came to Mount Sinai in 1955, training generations of students and residents in Hematology and in the Art and Science of Medicine. He served as AAS President from 1983-1984 and remained on the Board of Directors, playing an active role in constant support of the Mount Sinai physicians. In 1996, he received the prestigious Jacobi Medallion for his outstanding contributions to the institution. An avid cyclist, swimmer and steadfast champion of health and physical fitness, he traveled the world in pursuit of greater athletic and cultural endeavors. We salute his loyalty and legacy, and extend our sincere condolences to his family and many friends. Eric Neibart, MD, President Mark Reiner, MD, 1st Vice President Louis DePalo, MD, 2nd Vice President Harold Bronheim, MD, Secretary/Treasurer Amy Weinstein, Administrator

docs.lead_paragraph: As U.S. lawmakers investigate the anthrax and bird flu breaches at a federal laboratory, they have begun to question whether outside oversight of research using dangerous microbes is as independent as federal agencies claim.

headline.main: U.S. Rolls Back Oversight of Potentially Dangerous Experiments
headline.print_headline: U.S. Rolls Back Oversight of Potentially Dangerous Experiments

docs.snippet: As U.S. lawmakers investigate the anthrax and bird flu breaches at a federal laboratory, they have begun to question whether outside oversight of research using dangerous microbes is as independent as federal agencies claim.

docs.lead_paragraph: The executives mingled over tea and sugar cookies, and the chatter was upbeat. Their industry, they said at the conference in the Indian capital, saves lives and brings roofs, walls and pipes to some of the world's poorest people.

headline.main: Asbestos Pushed in Asia as Product for the Poor
headline.print_headline: Asbestos Pushed in Asia as Product for the Poor
